text: Always excellent! Fast service and good food!
Food is delicious and fairly priced, owner is extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes food!

Truly awful. i dont leave bad reviews like some other reviewers have said but this restaurant isnt even trying. Pad thai was soggy overcooked noodles green in color flavored with some curry powder red bell peppers and mostly beansprouts. No eggs no pickled ginger no peanuts no tofu. I dont think hes ever tasted pad thai before

Worst food experience I've ever had. I've worked in some dirty kitchens in my life, but just a glance at the one here made me uneasy. Tried it to give them the benefit of the doubt, but was nasty tasting and made me feel ill. All the food tasted the same since he used ghe same wok and didnt even wipe it out in between items. DO NOT EAT HERE.
Great food and service! Had the stir fry, potstickers, and the udon noodles and they were all delicious. Please go out and support this local business! A Missoula staple.
Great experience every time. Love all the drinks and the pastries are great. The staff is always so nice. I go there several days a week. 10/10 would recommend.

Coffee was weak and definitely not worth the price. Atmosphere was okay.

Owner: Just saw your response. I'm a little spoiled after living in Seattle for 30 years. So many great places to get coffee and pastries. I'll continue to give your places another shot.
They have the nicest staff!! Clean, open, great environment overall. I go here often to study and savor a different tea or coffee every time.üòÄ

I visited Missoula over Halloween weekend. I loved this place; they have delicious coffee. I got their Missoula roast and it smells and tastes great! Support your local business and come here! It was a good choice.

Nice space for working or studying with wifi and lots of outlets.

Decent coffee, pastries and sandwiches for breakfast or lunch.

Traveling through and found this place via google. Awesome location, building and atmosphere.
Had a great club sandwich and tried the coffee after lunch.
All was great!!! I highly recommend Market on Front!!
Thank You!!!

Nice ambiance with outdoor seating. Service was "meh".

Waited for literally 30 minutes to get 3 sandwiches to go. We weren't the only ones, either. And this is not an isolated incident. Staff was taking breaks in the middle of the lunch rush, kitchen was obviously not prepped ( heard several calls for "mayo packets" and watched one dude leisurely chop avocados. By the time I got my sandwich, it was tepid. The toast was cold and the turkey and bacon were room temp. It's too bad, too, because I like the concept of the place. But I'm not gonna waste any more money or time here until they figure out whether they want to be a restaurant or a market because they obviously can't do both well.

They say they offer gluten free food but don‚Äôt label which item is gluten free if you order in a group. Waited over an hour for food I can‚Äôt eat. When I called to ask which one was gluten free I was told ‚Äúyou should be able to tell‚Äù. Not good enough. When we got there we already saw several people ask about their food after waiting an hour. Horrible system for pickup and takeout orders.

The food is pretty good once you figure out how to get it, but the process for picking up orders is unclear and disorganized. Every time, I arrive well after the scheduled pickup time and never once has my food been sitting on the table ready for pickup. If I wanted to wait, I wouldn't have ordered pickup.
Great breakfast burrito. Love the set-up and the community that it inspires. Met a nice young man traveling through from  Seattle, on a road trip.

Such a great sports bar!!!  Came tonight as tourists from NY & received such a warm welcome from the staff and locals.  Great beer & drink selection, lots of TVs, very nice staff willing to change channels and turn up stations.  Staff member even bought us a round!  Thank you for your hospitality, Reds!
Bar is old college hangout. Great atmosphere for any football game. Bar management is incredible.
I sleep in every once in awhile and peek in and say hi and go in there for years it's a great traditional sports bar I don't know, I like the atmosphere
This bar is a must visit when in Missoula. It can be pretty crowded after Griz games...but isn't it supposed to be?
Belt, USA loves Red's! Thanks Mike!

My husband and I had a very nice meal with excellent service from Mackenzie at Scotty‚Äôs Table. We started with a tasty appetizer of bruschetta with salmon spread topped with thinly sliced red onion. My entree was chicken souvlaki served over hummus with a Greek salad. The chicken was perfectly grilled, juicy and excellent quality. My husband enjoyed his cioppino, and commented on the buttery mussels and yummy sauce. Both were paired with nice wine suggestions by Mackenzie. Highly recommend a meal at Scotty‚Äôs Table!

I'll give it three stars because the service was excellent and ambiance was relaxing and enjoyable. The food, however,  had some problems. We were a table of five and there was a problem with four of the five meals. The grits were too salty,  brisket one piece was too dry and unbeatable and steak too tough. The waitress was kind enough to refund the brisket because my friend complained about it. I love this place and hope to try it again, when I'm back in town. Hopefully it was a one time deal.

My husband and I dined here for the 1st time yesterday evening. We waited for a table for about 5 minutes and the hostess was so confused as to where she was gonna sit us, even though there were about 15 open table's, so that was awkward?  Once we did get sat, no one came over to greet us or offer drinks for at least 10 minutes. My husband ordered a pork chop I ordered the beef duo, both of these entrees require a steak knife. However, we did not get a steak knife nor did our server come over and ask how things were so we could ask him for 1. Have you ever tried to cut a steak, that was not tender and laced with fat or a pork chop with a butter knife, it was absolutely unbelievable. And because of this we will never be coming back to this restaurant that's supposed to be fine dining, I felt like I was at McDonald's.

My boyfriend and I have eaten brunch here many times and love it! We finally tried dinner to celebrate our anniversary and it was everything we could have asked for and more! Our lovely server, Mack was charming, knowledgeable and awesome and we had a great time. Wine was fabulous, food was amazing, especially the seafood cioppino and creme br√ªl√©e! We will definitely be back!

Good wine, good steak, good scallops, and good service!

We order the fried brussel sprouts, the Caesar salad (without anchovies...), scallops, and a steak. We loved the salad! The scallops were excellent and the sauces were great (my wife loves sauces), and the steak was great as well!

We didn't notice the delay in getting our food since the atmosphere was perfect for a warm night!

Always winning with a dish from here. SaWaDee brings it every time. Been going here for nearly 20 years, have yet to be let down. They are so nice, professional, and authentic: you know what they have, they are prompt, and best of all, they LOVE their customers like family. I send my daughter in Boston their Pad Thai sauce, its so good.

In the late 90's when I went to UM this place was my first ever Thai food experience. I think I literally ate here at least twice a week. It's actually some of the best Thai food I've ever had, having lived in Denver, Tokyo and Seattle, so I always make an effort to eat here when I'm in town.

I was planning on visiting again in October but sadly just read that they will be closing.  If you're in Missoula you must try this place before it's gone.

4 Stars because customer service was great. The guy that took my order was friendly, chipper, went out of his way to be nice. The pad thai: Left something to be desired. Not great, tasted like jarred pad thai sauce. Will give another chance because of the great customer service.
Visited on 08/02/21 at about 1:30pm and will NOT be returning specifically because of the cashier Bella who was extremely rude.
So delicious! Took the time to explain food and gave great recommendations. Excellent pricing as well!

Yep that was good! Had the sliced brisket platter. It's was delicious and tender. They have a good mix of sauces and they do serve Burnt Ends! (they were out when I came by) I lived in Kansas City for over 12 years and this Barbecue joint knows what they're doing.  Mix of regional styles on the barbecue and it all is great. Had the baked beans as a side and they were great also.

Great service and neat small hole in the wall restaurant atmosphere.

Will definitely be in when I buzz through town.

The brisket is on point. Well-trimmed with good smoke rings. The sandwich is a great size. I tried their spicy bbq sauce , also great, could use more kick for my tastes though

Atmosphere is great and the staff is very friendly. Very quick with the food, I hadn‚Äôt even filled my drink and the sandwich was out.

Arrive early. They were out of pulled pork when I arrived at 230

Coming from out of town, saw many favourable reviews about this restaurant. Considering there were multiple locations, I had high expectations. Ordered pulled pork sandwich with a side of max and cheese. Pulled pork was very flavourful but unfortunately very dry. The restaurant was trialling a new barbecue sauce which was good. The sauce helped with the pulled pork but enough sauce to make the pork juicy would have been too salty. Mac and cheese was very creamy and tasted good. Unfortunately it was cold. Overall is decent but there is room to improve. Maybe other dishes would do the store‚Äôs reputation justice.

I went here to try it out in the middle of the week and told myself that I would definitely be coming back! They have ribs that will rock your world, different sauces for every flavor that you‚Äôre looking for and don‚Äôt get me started on that mac&cheese! When I come back in town, I will definitely be coming back to this place.

My son made a comment tonight that sums this place up. There is nothing on the menu that isn't great. Throw a dart at the board and come away satisfied, wherever it hits.  Another bonus is the general mood of the employees. They are genuinely having fun, which makes this place even better.

Good food. Friendly staff. Great drinks. They have a mushroom French dip that is amazing! I tried a few different drinks and my favorite was the Doc Holiday which is made with Huckleberry vodka. Give this place a shot. You won‚Äôt be sorry.

Their 300th review! I very much enjoyed the Thunder IPA and their cheeseburger with tater tots. I got a flight and cannot remember all that I ordered, but that Thunder IPA sure was memorable. Fantastic ambience, great location, and very affordable. Next time I visit Missoula I will definitely come here!

I had a great time here. Nashville wings as appetizers tasted great, reminded me of living in Nashville and getting chicken with friends. Wonderful rubbed spice and the blue cheese dipping sauce was great with or without. A cauliflower option would be amazing!

Bison burger only comes cooked medium here, and that's okay. It was really good. Didn't feel greasy or overbearing. I love venison and bison, so I appreciate it done well in a burger.

Pulled pork was also just, super good. I only stole a couple bites from my boyfriend's plate... but... I really enjoyed the pulled pork. I believe it had a Carolina tangy sweetness that wasn't entirely like some of the Carolina BBQs I loved when I lived in NC, but still very good. I'd definitely come order it myself another time to fully experience.

I also had the flathead mule drink... Wasn't overly sweet or strong, just right for my date and with what I was eating. Pleasant when paired with all the spicy and savoury food.

The only thing I'd tweak is maybe breading the fries. They were otherwise just okay.

I had a lovely dinner all around and plan to come back to enjoy the lovely balcony area. ü•∞
Great beer great and attentive staff, top notch food and there's always an open table. You can't go wrong if you choose to visit Conflux.

Was part of party. Food and drinks were great. Our servers: Shannon, Gabby, and Paul, were attentive and on point. They were professional and personal. We had fun, enjoyed our meal, and walked away more than content. We didn‚Äôt want to leave. Highly recommended.

This was underwhelming.  The food was 3 stars, good but not something I need reservations for.  The atmosphere is modern, if that's your thing, cool.  We ordered some cocktails that were definitely not mixed properly, although I appreciate the 10 to 1 rum to mix recipe.  But what dropped 2 stars and almost to a 1 was when our server said there is 15 minutes left in happy hour, brought us that menu and then when she FINALLY returned to take our order, told us happy hour was over and we couldn't order from that menu anymore.  I almost walked out.
I did like the fundito.
I like trying new places, and I'm glad I did. I'll not have to wonder if I should go back.
Great street tacos and tortilla chips! Delicious guacamole that seemed like it was made as we ordered. Friendly and prompt service!

I love tacos. We went out of our way to make sure we tried this restaurant, and let me tell you, these were the BEST tacos. Fresh, unique ingredients and incredible atmosphere. I wish I could go once a week. The drinks were perfectly done, and staff was wonderful. Would highly recommend!

This is a great place for margaritas! The chips and salsa are great, but I have noticed inconsistencies with the flavor of guac. It didn't taste as good as prior visits, which is tough with the price. I would still definitely recommend checking out their happy hour.
Their tequila tasting choices could use some work but the food is REALLY good. And they partner/utilize local resources so that's pretty radical. Not Mexican owned but still good.

AMAZING!!! Great sushi! Great service! Our waitress Christina was perfect! She went through the menu with us and helped us pick sushi based on our personal preferences. Everyone was kind and there was not once that we felt ignored! One of the best restaurants I‚Äôve been to in a long time! All the food was fresh and they do not skimp on portions! If you are super hungry once you arrive order appetizers since the sushi takes a little bit of time to prepare. Some other reviews about the food taking too long is ridiculous to me! GOOD FOOD TAKES TIME TO PREPARE! If you don‚Äôt have patience for a talented chef to prepare an amazing meal for you then go to McDonald‚Äôs and stop complaining! Thank you again Saketome and Christina for making us feel so welcomed!
Happened upon this little hole in the wall and have honestly thought about our food there every week after. So good. Definitely going back! And they have a beautiful space!

Honestly, the best sushi restaurant I‚Äôve been to!!! I loved our waitress, and cooks. I wish I got their names. It was nice and quick to get into, the wait for our sushi was well worth it! A great place to go if you‚Äôre just looking for a place to sit with friends and family. Definitely coming back!!!!

Food wonderful, really delicious sauces. However, music was too loud on top of people talking it was deafening.   I love the food but would think hard about going there again.  They need some sound mufflers.

The sushi is really good. It looks good, tastes good, etc. Atmosphere is hip for downtown Missoula.

The service isn't. Wait staff very casual. Literally just having a chat with the tender while we wait for them to take our order (waited 15 minutes to place an order when it wasn't even busy).

Folks behind the sushi bar crushing beers left and right. I'm not against drinking, but this is highly unprofessional. The guys literally crouched down to consume their apparently "hidden" on-the-job drinking (you're working directly in front of me). Also handling some food with bare hands. Not a good scene even with many community members vaccinated.

The sushi rolls are very good. Very pricey, but I'd say in terms of taste, presentation, and amount, you get what you pay for (perhaps a bit pricey). In terms of service, absolutely not. If the service was even halfway decent, I'd give this at least 4 stars.

The menu was small but I went with the combo spicy and added veggies. I now understand why the menu was small. Because what they advertise is what they have perfected. Best chicken ever.  The best part is the chard sauced part of the chicken. Could of sworn i was eating chicken off a charcoal grill. So amazing. Serving is huge. I recommend the veggies added too.  Parking is a pain during lunch hours but its worth it on so many levels. My new weekly treat. Quality, taste, and value all 11/10s.
Delicious and fast. anytime I can make it to the zoo during the week I stop here.  Wish they had it in my area. Big portions too

Impressed! I have eaten a lot of teriyaki in my 60+ years but this is on another level. Let's start with the meat. The chicken was so moist it had to be marinated for hours. The beef had zero fat and gristle and was tender and flavorful. I'm used to a little cabbage slaw on the side but the $2 veggie add on was phenomenal. The pea pods tasted fresh and crispy, onions and peppers (not green bell thank goodness) were awesome. The quantities on the combo were enough for two meals. Fantastic.

Dobi's can stand toe to toe with the best teriyaki in western Washington.  It is a real treat to have a place like this in Missoula.  Other places in Missoula claim to have teriyaki, but only Dobi's does it right.  Hot, fresh, done right, at an easy price.
I love this place! Huge portions for the money and taste great, I'm from Marysville, WA and it's taste like a place called Tokyo stop in Marysville where I ate as a child brings back memories

Subway is always a good place LMK ace to eat, and this place was no different. The menu selection was varied and the staff was fast, polite, and helpful. It was especially busy but fast service still today when the other two fast food restaurants across the street were closed or window only.

This was some of the best service we've ever had at a Subway. I did not get the gentlemans name, but he had a bunch of tattoos. He really seemed to enjoy his job and that showed in how he listened and treated us. I know its just a sandwich, but the experience made our day after being on the road all day. He was very friendly and personable. Would totally stop here again!

They were busy, like - I had to wait outside bysy. There were three people working and literally running the it butts of while I waited. Their level of care for the clients as well as care for the product in unequivocally professional for these young people doing their best to hold things together. They deserved a healthy tip, which they got, as well as some kind words. I just saw a meme that said "Everywhere is understaffed. Please be kind to those who showed up to work." They all did a fantastic job and I apaud them! üëè
Visited just before closing they were out of several things. The one employee was very kind and helpful
Alright. Did load up the jalapenos... Yeah! Marvelous, marvelous!

Amazing shop, everyone there is awesome to work with. The shop is clean and professional with amazingly talented artists. I recommend them to anyone. And I receive compliments on my tattoos from this shop regularly!
Came in from Salt Lake to have Ian sling a piece. Love the result and the shop is awesome, thanks!
They do great work and got me in quick
I had a cover up done and I am satisfied with the results

I got my first tattoo done in January by Nick! It looks beautiful with great detailing and healed nicely. The overall experience was great. The shop is super clean and I would 100% get another tattoo from here.
Great service! Delicious pizza! Thanks to Emma & Matt, we look forward to having you cater again!

Highly recommend! Clove Cart catered my wedding and they did an amazing job. The pizza was incredible and our guests absolutely loved it. On top of that, they were easy to work with and went above and beyond in providing our gluten-free and vegan guests with options. I would give them more stars if I could.
The BEST pizza wood fired pizza ever! I hired them to do a welcome dinner for guests during my wedding weekend. Very professional and easy to work with.  I recommend the sausage date pizza- so good!
The best pizza in town!! I love when I see Clove Cart at events around town, especially at big sky concerts and Travelers Rest Festival. A slice and a salad, its the best deal!!
Highly recommend them to cater your next event.  You won't be disappointed!

Elisabeth is a talented- compassionate- thorough practitioner; She is organized, efficient, effective. My 3 children have each worked with Elisabeth (each with academic evaluations, specialized instruction, & educational consultation) under her care, each has grown in academic skills and self-esteem/ self confidence.  Elisabeth provided us with support along the IEP process through advocacy and data-driven dialogue and to ensure our children‚Äôs needs are being uniquely met and align with  IDEA. She worked with us through advocacy and  has the ability to communicate clearly & in ways that parents understand. She was & remains essential in navigating these complicated processes.  Elisabeth has also worked with our family in accepting the learning challenges ahead and helped us find ways to live along side learning differences- she has helped my children see their potential. I am eternally grateful for Elisabeth and everything she has done for our family!

Our son initially struggled with reading, testing below benchmark at the beginning of 2nd grade. He did not enjoy reading and his confidence was low. Elizabeth performed some tests and quickly discovered that he needed rules to make the words and pronunciation make sense. He‚Äôs now in 4th grade with reading scores up and is no longer a self-described ‚Äúbad reader‚Äù. He now carries a book with him to his brother‚Äôs soccer games and to restaurants just in case there is an opportunity to get a few pages of reading in. Huge thanks to Elizabeth for getting us over the reading hump!
Both of our children have had tutoring services here and have had excellent results.

I don‚Äôt go into Worden‚Äôs if I can help it because the space is very crowded and it causes me to make purchasing decisions I otherwise would not due to the atmosphere. They have a good selection of imported items and the deli food is hit or miss but can be good at times. Ten years ago it was the best option in town but they don‚Äôt seem invested in evolving to meet competition and the nostalgic factor is not much of a draw for me anymore.
Love his place.  Has been a favorite my entire adult life.  Some of the changes from the deli side are strange.  Where are the sandwich by the inch and amazing soups and salads?

Everything from the food to the service to the variety of wine.

Wardens is a staple of Missoula and it must stop for all travelers!

They have great grab & go lunches. If you prefer your lunch not pre made they have an expensive deli.
Great local spot recommended to me by a local. The Reuben was phenomenal. The service was friendly and fast. Excellent beverage and grocery selection as well. Must-hit spot in Missoula!
Always love this place. We stop literally every time we're in Missoula. Huge beer and wine selection as well as a great deli counter.

I ordered an apple cake for my husbands birthday. It was the most amazing cake we've ever had! So delicious. So delicately spiced. So light and moist at the same time. You were very pleasant to work with as well. Excellent work!

Not only was the German chocolate cake I ordered delicious, but they went WAY above and beyond to deliver it to a restaurant for me since I was coming in from out of town for a birthday lunch (they even called the restaurant to arrange everything for me!). Everyone loved the cake... it was the perfect amount of sweetness and was beautifully decorated. Check them out for sure...you won't be sorry!

Delicious donuts without having to sacrifice my health? Yes please! Tandem Donuts are amazing and the adorable family who make them pour their whole hearts into the process. If you haven‚Äôt tried them then please do yourself a favor and enjoy!

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! We have bought many things, all being outstanding, this review I will talk about they‚Äôre CAkES!! So delicious there are not words good enough for it! And all they‚Äôre ingredients are good for the environment and the animals it‚Äôs just an all out win! Check out the photos of this cake.

Best gluten free bread I‚Äôve ever had!! I‚Äôm so happy Tandem Bakery can provide my family with the vegan and GF foods we miss so much. The owner was so kind and accommodating when we picked up our order.
Highly recommend the breakfast burrito. Great spot to grab some high quality food very quickly. Prices aren't cheap but are fair for the taste and quality of the food. Would definitely go back.
Great place, amazing food, but I found a small, hard piece of plastic while biting into my burrito.

Are you having a rough day? If so, go get a Vegan Burrito from Golden Yolk Griddle and watch your day vastly improve. They have an excellent menu, very friendly staff, and they get you your order quickly. Highly recommend.
Great price, staff that treated each other like family and there was a big Saturday night BBQ going on in parking lot. Very family friendly3
Love this place! Everyone is super nice and they use very well sources ingredients (ie. Local, organic, etc.). Food is super yummy, too ;)

First - didn't have to wait to get a table and be served! Super! Second - great food at a great price! Third - great service, so I tipped a bit more! Thoroughly enjoyed the big screen TV's that weren't too loud and were positioned well. Fun atmosphere and deco. What more could you ask for?
The servers are so nice and the kitchen staff seem generally pleased! The food is delicious and the presentation of it looks professional! It is a little pricey but the experience is well worth it.

Haven‚Äôt heard amazing things about this place but wanted to give it a try. To start, servers were callous and cold. Really unpleasant experience with both ladies that served us. Appetizer never came out until main meals were served. Sent my mimosa back because the glass was filthy. Not just water stains, actual dirty glass. Veggie burger had a single piece of lettuce. Mimosa and blood mary were mediocre at best. Had to approach the bar several times for different reasons. And to top it all off, the owners replies on these reviews are incredibly surprising. Very unprofessional. Almost vile to read what is being said back to people.
Good food and drinks. Try the calamari, or one of the specials. Everything I've tried has been awesome.
The watermelon Poke bowl is amazing!! It was so fresh and yummy! We had the sweetest server who was on top of her game and we enjoyed our little lunch family date there.

This is a good JJ‚Äôs location. The sandwich was well constructed and service was prompt and courteous. My table was clean and all staff were wearing masks.
I would eat here again.
This JJ location is stellar! My coworkers and I order from here frequently, and we always get high quality food. Additionally, we also get treated to fun doodles on our sandwiches.
Typical JJ's; decent fast sandwiches; but beware that the local franchise "does not participate" in the Promotions that you see advertised so  heavily. Keep that in mind when selecting.
Place is FREAKY FAST...lemme tell you whatüòÇ

Tasty and friendly.
There, you read it; Go get yourself some lunch here!
Loved this bar. The bartender Tabby is wonderful and so quick in a busy bar. Food was also great!
Great place and even better people.
dive bar with interesting people, if that is your thing.
Great grubüç∫üòÅ friendly people

Camped out here for three days last time I was in Missoula; I'd been to Charlie's before, but had yet to try the Dino Cafe out...well, I did this time and it was DYNAMITE (catfish po'boy, more specifically). A very animated, very special group of people in here, from the bartenders to the regulars. They made me feel like I was at home as soon as I walked in.

I'm so happy to have found Dr. Raveloot to treat my depression and anxiety. For many years, I was skeptical of seeking treatment, but his friendly, compassionate, and highly skilled techniques helped me to change my thinking patterns quite dramatically. I feel as though a whole new way of looking at the world has been revealed to me. Thank you so much!
Great company with true Montana values!
Great food! Breakfast sandwich is awesome, as is the breakfast burrito. Fast and friendly service. What more could you want?
Very good. Very expensive. INSANELY small portions.  I will not waste $11 on a six inch meatball sandwich with four total meatballs ever again. Highway robbery
Delicious, efficient, balanced, very reasonable pricing, creative foods as well some traditional fares. Loved the atmosphere of team work
Great bread, great meat, crisp veggies, what more could you want from a sandwich? Service was quick and friendly.

Based on local reviews, I had high hopes for Doc's! I had the Dr. Frankenstein, and my wife had something with pastrami and tomatoes. Service was great, and the sangies came out fast. Alas, nothing special here. Assembly was neat and sterile. Meats were ok, veg were ok, and if you love dijon mustard, this is your place. Unfortunately for us the dijon was overpowering, and my wife disassembled her sandwich to wipe off most of the (copious) dijon. It's a good little shop, but I don't think we will go back, as there are lots of other great options in Missoula.
It had a lot of hype from folks in the area, but while the service was great, the food itself simply didn't live up to the rumors.

This place exceeded our expectations. We ordered 4 appetizers and 5 entrees and every single item was delicious. We shared everything. The Wisconsin cheddar burger is in the top three of best burgers I‚Äôve ever had. The homemade giant tater tots were out of this world. Fried pickles were on point. The ahi tacos, the Brussels sprouts‚Ä¶ everything was so good. The service was great too. Great beer and wine selection. Specialty cocktails. The patio was a fun atmosphere. We all can‚Äôt wait to go back.

First and last time ordering to go. Everything we asked for was ignored, toppings, sides, how well done. I was fine with it taking 30 minutes longer, but that was with the expectation the order would be correct.

It was wonderful taking my dearest friend and travel partner to lunch in such a lovely outdoor setting. She is 88 years old and isn't able to get out much. We have traveled the world together and she was just as thrilled having lunch at the Top Hat as she was enjoying an omelet at a sidewalk cafe in Paris.  The food was delicious! She kept looking around and saying "I don't want to go home!"  We are grateful that the Top Hat has provided outdoor seating where we can feel safe from Covid.  I wish I could remember our waiter's name because he was great!  Thank you for a lovely afternoon! I know these are hard times for businesses but I want you to know you can ... and do ... make a difference!

Amazing, fresh ingredients, perfectly cooked!  we had the Wisconsin burgers, best I have had in a long time.  great fries, and the sauces are original to them fresh and perfect salad, and great service.  will come here anytime we are in town.

Delicious! I normally vacation to great falls but the great falls location is awful. Skimpy servings no flavor or just totally wrong orders so when I stopped here in missoula, I saw them making this and I knew it was going to be delicious. Didn't disappoint and actually super filling BUT there was hardly any meat in it so I mostly got full off of rice.
Highly recommend! So yummy & fresh. Eat in our easily take it to go. Healthy & filling. Chill vibe

one of my favorite places in Zootown
So yummy and quick. Open pretty late too for any people who want something healthy in the evening hours. CHEESE BUNS ARE GOD

Every separate item I added to my massive rice bowl was delicious! Something like $12 total for a large, and a large bowl was enough for two meals. I didn't even add meat, and it was outstanding.  Wanted to try vegan food, but next time we come through town we'll try the BBQ. I wish Spokane had a Five on Black!

I was in town for a night and saw good reviews on this one. This place did not disappoint me at all. I took the stew with white rice and spicy coconut and each of us ordered different proteins like fish and chicken. Lovely food, nice trance music allows you to enjoy the food and I would say you must visit this place.

I don't know where to start. How about with the Apple & Honeycomb salad! It was delicate  yet full of flavor and ample for the first course. The wine selection was decent with a broad cross-section of wines which paired well with menu choices. For an Entree, we chose a halibut which was cooked in paper. It was tender and absolutely wonderful. It helps when  the chef is an owner.
The Main menu offered six delicious well rounded choices and many of the selections rotate on a daily basis. What a joy to sit down, make a choice, order a drink and get on with the evening.
This was our first time experience here and with Jazz in the lobby every other Wednesday, we will be back. Sooner than later.
We had great service and a great French 75! Good appetizers too!

I have been here a couple times now and can say it's a very nice treat to dine/drink here. Seemed like the dinning area was bigger than the last time we were there. Best part was, it didn't sacrifice any of the environment. Still clean, cozy, and delightful.

Really amazing food and atmosphere.  I had a mojito and the tenderloin.  Both were really good.  Tenderloin was cooked perfectly.  Wife had pork chop and the Pineapple Express cocktail.  Looking forward to return and trying other food and drinks.  Service was on pint as well.
The food here is delicious and there is such a great ambiance. I cannot say enough about the server. Everything was perfect.
The owner of the B&B that we stayed at highly recommended this place. Really nice atmosphere, open top floor was very nice. The food was delicious and they had some good local brews.

We started with the Butternut squash soup and had to take a moment after the first spoonful yo appreciate the buttery goodness! Then of course we had the fried chickens. It was crazy crispy on the outside and so moist and juicy on the inside! We will definitely be back!

I've been here a bunch of times for the last several years. Food and service fluctuate as you might expect. Cool atmosphere inside, Deck overlooks the parking lot and alley.
Update: new ownership cleaned the place up nicely. Still hip but not nearly as grungy. The chicken sandwich is outrageous.... Literally. I added a star just for that.

Sampled some drinks from their specialty cocktail menu and they were delicious. Service was 10million times better than it was back in "the day". Food was served in a reasonable time frame and we all cleared our plates so I'd say it's above par. To top it off Josh Farmer was playing piano and taking requests and we had a wonderful time tipping him for some requested tunes- really made for a warm atmosphere. Definitely back in to my downtown rotation of dinner choices when guests come to Missoula.

They are back !!!! The food was amazing, the atmosphere charming and the drinks are phenomenal.
So happy to have this top notch establishment. The street tacos and chicken sandwich are the best in town .
I ate at the Old Post last night.  What a great place! Great bar food!  It reminded me of my college days.
